title: Machine Learning Integrated Robotics for Learning Physical Artistry
excerpt: Currently, I'm focused on using ML and Computer Vision to detect line drawings and programmatically draw realistic shading
description:
One of the main reasons I'm working at FAR-Labs in NYC is to pursue my personal research on augmenting the physical artist's workflow. Currently, I'm focused on using ML and Computer Vision to detect line drawings and programmatically draw realistic shading on them.

Shadowing can be challenging for novice physical artists, but once they have a robotic pen plotter shade for them when given a point light direction, they begin to understand its intricacies.

title: Custom Audio Machine Learning for Robotic Design
excerpt: Through node-red, Google's Teachable Machines, and a ton of backend development, we hope to provide a simple process for building robots that naturally react
description:
One of my advisors, David Goedicke, does extensive research into how audio can be used to improve human-robotics interactions through machine learning. I've spent a better part of this summer programming with him to create a streamlined system that allows anyone to upload their own audio ML models and use them to control a small robot.

Through node-red, Google's Teachable Machines, and a ton of backend development, we hope to provide a simple process for building robots that naturally react to sounds in ways not possible to the average, non-technical person.

Links to both custom node-red nodes can be found on my GitHub.
